intro: Polygonum mississippiense var. interius, commonly known as the Mississippi polygonum, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants commonly referred to as buckwheats. The species is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically alternate, lance-shaped, and have a distinctive reddish or purple tinge along the veins. This variant is often found in moist, disturbed soils near streams and wetlands.
